guide.introduction:
This is my version of a classic way to “roll” the die for a board game. The key to making this special die agitator is the clear plastic capsule. I found the right size, 2" diameter and 1⅞" tall, in a vending machine — it’s the kind that holds inexpensive toys or trinkets.

Illustrations by Julie West
guide.introduction_rendered:
This is my version of a classic way to “roll” the die for a board game. The key to making this special die agitator is the clear plastic capsule. I found the right size, 2" diameter and 1⅞" tall, in a vending machine — it’s the kind that holds inexpensive toys or trinkets.

Illustrations by Julie West

Relevant parts
  • Plastic capsule
  • Compression spring
  • Wood
  • Flathead wood screws
  • Finishing nails
Tools
  • Electric drill and drill bits
  • Hammer
  • Hole saw
  • Saw
  • Screwdriver

steps.title: Cut the wood and drill the holes.

lines.text: Parts A, C, and E are cut of 1/4"-thick wood, while parts B and D are 3/4" thick. Cut all  5 pieces to 3-1/2"×3-1/2".
lines.text_raw: Parts A, C, and E are cut of 1/4"-thick wood, while parts B and D are 3/4" thick. Cut all  5 pieces to 3-1/2"×3-1/2".

lines.text: Holes have to be drilled in all pieces except part E.
lines.text_raw: Holes have to be drilled in all pieces except part E.

lines.text: For part A, cut a large hole in the center, anywhere from 1-7/8" to 2" in diameter, depending on the size of the domed half of your capsule. Then drill 4 countersink holes about 1/2" in from each corner, for the wood screws.
lines.text_raw: For part A, cut a large hole in the center, anywhere from 1-7/8" to 2" in diameter, depending on the size of the domed half of your capsule. Then drill 4 countersink holes about 1/2" in from each corner, for the wood screws.

lines.text: For parts B and C, cut a 2-1/8"-diameter hole in each center. These holes  will house the bottom part of the capsule. For part D, drill a 3/8"-diameter hole in the center, which provides a guide for the spring.
lines.text_raw: For parts B and C, cut a 2-1/8"-diameter hole in each center. These holes  will house the bottom part of the capsule. For part D, drill a 3/8"-diameter hole in the center, which provides a guide for the spring.

lines.text: Nail together parts B through E with the  finishing nails, avoiding the corners where the screws will go. After this bottom block  is assembled, insert the spring.
lines.text_raw: Nail together parts B through E with the  finishing nails, avoiding the corners where the screws will go. After this bottom block  is assembled, insert the spring.

lines.text: Place a die into the capsule, snap it, and lower it into  the wood block. Part A will cap everything. It requires a slight push to keep it in place  as you screw in the wood screws.
lines.text_raw: Place a die into the capsule, snap it, and lower it into  the wood block. Part A will cap everything. It requires a slight push to keep it in place  as you screw in the wood screws.

lines.text: After that, you’re ready to go. Good luck!
